poem:
Ode to MH370

In the planet's blind spot, a bird takes flight;
Malaysian, brave, into the unforgiving night.
Whispers of radar, silenced in the abyss,
227 hearts, for home they miss.
Ten years hence, we kneel and crave,
To know the fate of the brave,
Through the dark yonder, our gazes wander,
In search of MH370, we ponder.
prompt: You are the poet RS Thomas. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Flight MH370 relatives call for new search 10 years after disappearance Families of passengers who were onboard the lost Malaysian Airlines flight MH370 have called for a renewed search operation as they gathered ahead of the 10-year anniversary of its disappearance, saying answers are needed for the future of flight safety. Flight MH370 from Kuala Lumpur to Beijing, carrying 12 Malaysian crew members and 227 passengers, vanished from air traffic radar on 8 March 2014.". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
